Global Communication Disruption: The internet has facilitated global communication, making it possible for people to connect with each other instantly and easily through email, social media, and video calls. Without the internet, people would have to return to traditional forms of communication, such as letters and phone calls, which could drastically slow down international communication.

E-commerce Collapse: Online shopping has become increasingly popular as retailers have moved their businesses online. Without the internet, customers would have to rely on brick-and-mortar stores, which could result in significantly less convenience and accessibility.

Virtual Disconnect: Many people have built extensive virtual networks through social media, video games, and virtual communities. Without the internet, these connections would be lost, potentially leading to feelings of isolation and loneliness.
Access to Entertainment: Streaming platforms, online games, and other forms of online entertainment would no longer be accessible, interrupting the leisure lives of many people.

News and Information Blackout: The internet has made it easy to access local, national, and international news in real time. Without it, people would have to rely on traditional news sources, which could be slower and less comprehensive.
